TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ContractNamespaceAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies the CLR namespace and XML namespace of the data contract.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Apply the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ContractNamespaceAttribute> attribute to an assembly that contains types to which the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute> has been applied. The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ContractNamespaceAttribute> enables you to set a namespace that is different than the one generated when the type is serialized. For more information about how names are generated, see [Data Contract Names](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-contract-names.md).
If you are using a type to conform to an existing data contract, you must match the namespace of the existing contract by using the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ContractNamespaceAttribute> (or the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute.Namespace%2A> property of the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute> class).
> [!NOTE] > In any code, you can use the word `ContractNamespace` instead of the longer <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ContractNamespaceAttribute>.
## Examples The following example shows the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ContractNamespaceAttribute> applied to an assembly.
[!code-csharp[ContractNamespaceAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/contractnamespaceattribute/cs/overview.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ContractNamespaceAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/contractnamespaceattribute/vb/overview.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string contractNamespace) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the supplied namespace.
Gets or sets the CLR namespace of the data contract type.
Docs.value: The CLR-legal namespace of a type.

Docs.summary: Gets the namespace of the data contract members.
Docs.value: The namespace of the data contract members.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can only be set using the constructor when applying the attribute to an assembly.
